name: Legacy Golf Resort

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: We had the opportunity to stay at the Legacy twice in the last month. The facillities and accomodations were top notch and were especially great considering the reasonable price. We will definately be staying there in the future.
Nice place with beautiful grounds & large units. Plenty of free

reviews.text: We three "ladies of a certain age" enjoy vacationing at The Legacy every summer (when the prices are a bargain).
reviews.title: Love The Legacy
great choice for quiet relaxation
reviews.text: The accommodations are wonderful, and the staff friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our last visit was memorable, in that we had to wait quite a bit to check into our rooms. The previous guest had not checked out on schedule. We were kept waiting in an adjacent room while the room was cleaned, sterilized, and the coroner and hearse had left the property. Being level headed ladies, we had no problem sharing our space with the departed spirit, but we were disturbed by the soaking wet carpet. We had to request mattress pads to walk upon to avoid slipping and breaking our necks on the soapy floors. A couple of days after check in, one of the ladies and I went out shopping, leaving our hard of hearing friend to nap. When we returned, we discovered that we had locked ourselves out, and no amount of door pounding would wake up our friend. The security fellow who came to our aid, looked peaked when we explained our situation, and asked if our friend had any ailments, how old was she, etc......I knew he was thinking of the previous guest. "Lordy lordy, not again".
reviews.title: It was okay...

likes.liked: — There was a live singer/guitarist by the pool
likes.disliked: — Room needed to be refurbished/carpet cleaning needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our "room mate" was a quiet type, and after the carpets dried, the four of us had a nice week together. We plan to return as soon as possible.....but we think our roomie has "crossed over".
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay !!

likes.liked: — The large size of the 1 bedroom suites.
likes.disliked: — Having to Pay $9.95 per day for the Internet.

reviews.text: A convenient 10 minute drive from the airport. but you never hear planes. Surrounded by nurseries, a few condo places and some rural homes it is very quiet here. 10 minutes from outlet mall Arizona Mills and quick access to freeways for 30 minute drive to Anthem Outlets and about 35 minutes to Old Scottsdale & Fashion Square Mall (regular retail - more designer shops). Not a large number of restaurants around but Gallaghers is good for those wanting to view sports on many TV screens and the restaurant at the Legacy has never disappointed. Rooms are extremely clean - lower rate given on service only because housekeeping missed us a couple of times during our week visit. This was my 3rd visit here. They have a slightly odd set up in that some rooms patios look over the parking lot.
reviews.title: Well-Kept Secret - Super Stay!

likes.disliked: — tie between the lack of parking and the poor housekeeping

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort in Phoenix
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Legacy Golf Resort the weekend we got married. We also recommended the resort to our guests that were traveling from out of state. It was absolutely perfect and all our guests agreed. The resort itself is beautiful and they keep the grounds immaculate. We opted for the bigger of the two rooms offered and it worked out great that weekend. It had a full kitchen and separate living/dining area. It was perfect for myself and my two bridesmaids, moms, hairdresser, and makeup artist to all get ready for the big day. It was very comfortable and almost felt like we were getting ready at home. It was also nice to relax in the big two person jacuzzi tub each evening. If you are looking to get away for the weekend and suggest somewhere for out of town guests we would highly recommend the Legacy. Staying at the Legacy completed our fairytale wedding weekend!!! We look forward to coming back to celebrate our one year anniversary.

reviews.title: Recent Stay
reviews.text: Alisa and Bryan

Resort is picturesque, the pool was great. Other than that the Staff was unfriendly and uninformative did not go out of the way to assist in questions or give out information. Golf was slow at best, many times there were four foursomes on one hole with two waiting on the tee box.
reviews.title: Guys golfing had great time

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, quiet, nice kitchen, spacious, good furnishings
likes.disliked: — BBQ area remote and poorly equipped, some units far from common area

reviews.title: Great golf, no-so-great complex
reviews.text: Late on tee time by 1/2 hour. Took over 5 1/2 hours to play 18.
Only has one restaurant on premises food was good. But no variety or atmosphere. Had to leave resort for any entertainment or variety.
reviews.title: Happy returning customer

description: The Legacy Resort is an oasis of green at the base of Phoenix’s scenic and well known South Mountain. Featuring spacious suites decorated in Spanish mission-style with rich wood cabinetry and earth-toned fabrics and a full kitchen or kitchenette. An on-site 18-hole championship golf course that was named a top 10 Golf Courses to play in Phoenix by Golf Digest. Also a sparkling pool and a deluxe health club, coupled with an endless variety of recreational activities amidst an inviting resort community. Make The Legacy Golf Resort your destination for a romantic getaway, family vacation, reunion or golf outing. We are ready to help you create your legacy.
